title: Supreme Court Confronts Trump and His Tariffs in Test of Presidential Power
summary: The justices face a so-called legitimacy dilemma as they deal with a tricky legal dispute and a president who has made clear he would view defeat as a personal insult.

title: Jack Smith, Trump’s Target, Moves From Defense to Counterattack
summary: The former special counsel has told people in his orbit he welcomes the opportunity to present the public case against the president denied to him by adverse court rulings and the 2024 election.

title: Ford Foundation Leader Vows to Protect Elections and Law as Trump Threatens Crackdown
summary: Heather K. Gerken, a voting rights scholar and former dean of Yale Law School, plans to intensify its emphasis on democracy as it girds for attacks from the Trump administration.

title: In Redistricting Battles, Here’s How Trump, Republicans and Democrats Are Faring
summary: President Trump is imploring lawmakers to redraw their congressional maps to stave off Democratic control of the House. But the debate over redistricting has revealed fissures within both parties.

title: The Nationwide Battle Over Electoral Maps
summary: What began with Texas drawing what could be five new Republican districts in the House of Representatives at President Trump’s behest has spiraled into a nationwide redistricting race. Nick Corasaniti, a New York Times reporter covering national politics, gives an overview.

title: Future of Gerrymandering? Here’s How Weird Things Could Look.
summary: These extreme maps may not be likely, but they might soon be legal, with temptations to go further than ever before.

title: Moon Duchin on the Math of Gerrymandering
summary: Why the challenge of truly representative democracy is so complex.

title: Elections Across the U.S. Will Test Democrats’ Momentum Ahead of 2026 Midterms
summary: Democrats have no federal contests that would allow them to check President Trump’s power, but governors’ races, mayoral contests and referendums will test momentum and divisions in both parties.

title: ‘Political Scores’ Use Reams of Data to Predict Your Vote
summary: Meet Mark Grebner, the Michigan statistician who helped pioneer the science of predicting whether someone will vote Republican or Democratic.

title: Our Election Guide
summary: Tomorrow is an off-year Election Day across the United States. We explain what is happening.

title: Kimberly-Clark to Buy Tylenol Maker Kenvue for $40 Billion
summary: The owner of Kleenex and Huggies will acquire the company that has fought unproven claims by the Trump administration that a common pain reliever is linked to autism.

title: John Irving Talks About ‘Queen Esther,’ Trump and Why He Can’t Stop Writing
summary: The literary titan is still publishing books, and still pushing envelopes, at 83. But you will not see him in the United States anytime soon.

title: China Started Separating Its Economy From the West Years Ago
summary: Two decades of sustained effort to build national self-reliance and minimize imports have antagonized trade partners but fortified what a senior adviser called Beijing’s “bulwark” against conflicts.

title: ‘A Big Positive’: How One Company Plans to Profit From Medicaid Cuts
summary: New work requirements are expected to leave millions of poor Americans uninsured. For Equifax, which charges states steep prices for its trove of employment data, it is a business opportunity.

title: How Medicaid’s New Work Requirement Will Work
summary: Poor Americans will face new challenges to enroll, and states will have to build new bureaucracies.

title: Control of Tesla Is at Stake in Vote on Elon Musk’s Pay Plan
summary: Mr. Musk’s supporters say he may quit if shareholders don’t approve a trillion-dollar package. Some investors say it’s excessive and would give him too much sway.

title: OpenAI Signs $38 Billion Cloud Computing Deal With Amazon
summary: After signing agreements to use computing power from Nvidia, AMD and Oracle, OpenAI is teaming up with the world’s largest cloud computing company.

title: Arrests in Louvre Heist Show Power of DNA Databases in Solving Crimes
summary: France’s trove of DNA profiles has helped solve high-profile crimes and was used to find some of the Louvre suspects, and it is growing. The police can also access other countries’ databases.

title: Louvre Heist: What to Know About the Suspects and Investigation
summary: Three of the four people whom the police believe carried out the theft have been arrested. But the jewelry is nowhere to be found.

title: After Fleeing a Massacre, Survivors Encountered Still More Gunfire and Abductions
summary: Thousands of people who witnessed atrocities have tried to escape El Fasher in Sudan’s Darfur region since paramilitary fighters seized that city in late October.

title: How A.I. Is Transforming Dating Apps
summary: Meet your artificial intelligence matchmakers. These A.I. tools are changing dating apps, so users don’t have to swipe through an endless scroll of profiles.

title: Facebook Dating Has Become a Surprise Hit for the Social Network
summary: Facebook’s free dating service has 21 million users, more than the popular dating app Hinge, as the social network reinvents itself.

title: How the Interborough Express Could Transform New York
summary: The new light-rail train, linking Queens and Brooklyn, would signal a shift in the city’s center of gravity, toward one less tethered to the office towers of Midtown.

title: These Israeli Dissidents Can Show Americans How to Be a Good Citizen of a Bad Country
summary: And why it matters so much to try.

title: Bernie Sanders: ‘There Ain’t Much of a Democratic Party’
summary: The Vermont senator on how to take the country back from elites — on both sides of the aisle.

title: Torre dei Conti Partially Collapses in Rome, Trapping Worker
summary: Rescue workers were trying to remove the man from the debris at the medieval tower, but said it was a dangerous operation. Another man was seriously injured in the collapse.

title: A Bloody Prison Beating Was Caught on Video. No Guards Were Punished.
summary: A New York prisoner accused corrections officers of assault and sexual abuse. State officials deemed his claims unfounded despite footage of the encounter.

title: In Israel, an Unfamiliar Word Is Heard: Peace
summary: A new kind of Mideast peace process is underway, as a determined Trump administration and its allies in the Muslim world seek to broaden a tenuous cease-fire between Israel and Hamas.

title: In Mexico, Killer Whales Take Down Great White Sharks
summary: A pod of orcas in the Gulf of California has repeatedly hunted juvenile white sharks to feast on their livers.
